Articles.Content:
There are a lot of pictures posted at night or in shadow that are really impossible to make out. Its a shame as they are often of interesting craft and locations. 

If possible, warp forward until you get some daylight for some nicer pictures.

Instructions unclear.

![rzAeEOs.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rzAeEOs.jpg)
Sometimes you can't timewarp to get better light. I say bring back ambient light!

> 
> Sometimes you can't timewarp to get better light. I say bring back ambient light!

Then just accept your failure and commemorate something else! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

> 
> There are a lot of pictures posted at night or in shadow that are really impossible to make out. Its a shame as they are often of interesting craft and locations. 
> If possible, warp forward until you get some daylight for some nicer pictures.

QTF!

I know it's not always possible to get out of the shadows but there are still a lot of pictures which are taken with the sun in the background(!). You can't see a thing on them. There are whole galleries only with this kind of screenshots.

If you upload to imgur, you can edit and 'magic up' images to brighten, sharpen and do other fancy wide-rimmed glasses stuff.

If I have a dark image (rarely) I might play with the contrast, lighting.

> ![twhqaHf.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/twhqaHf.png?1)
> [CLICK FOR FULL SIZE](http://i.imgur.com/twhqaHf.png?1)

It is pretty evident when you see how the rest of the landscape isn't as lit up. Note that I didn't slam the brightness up all the way either. Wouldn't want the picture to look like crap. Just enough for stuff to be discernible.

More often than not, I simply wont take screenshots if they wouldn't turn out serviceable.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-19T09:20:45Z" title="02/19/2015 09:20  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 19, 2015</time> by Axelord FTW**

> 
> Then just accept your failure and commemorate something else! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

But I like commemorating reentry...![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Instructions unclear.

"Got Jeb stuck in the ceiling capsule".
No one wants to see pictures where the sun doesn't shine. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Sometimes you cant help it. 

![00tZxHJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/00tZxHJ.jpg)

> 
> Sometimes you cant help it. 
> [http://i.imgur.com/00tZxHJ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/00tZxHJ.jpg)

Sometime it **is** the point of the picture.

Re-entry flame effects are best seen at night. Showing off the lighting of your rover's lightbeams and so on are a-ok.

Some people just take their time (not an event but a planned photoshoot) to showcase something and yet they take pictures in the worst conditions.
Thats so dark, that i can not make out very much ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Sometime it **is** the point of the picture.
> Re-entry flame effects are best seen at night. Showing off the lighting of your rover's lightbeams and so on are a-ok.
> 
> Some people just take their time (not an event but a planned photoshoot) to showcase something and yet they take pictures in the worst conditions.

Yeah i agree completely about the re-entry ones, the effects just look cool at dark, admitted you cant see jack about the craft haha, people should probably always take more than just 1 photo ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

![m05s6sv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/m05s6sv.jpg)

![xbT57bX.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xbT57bX.jpg)
I agree, especially when people use said screenshots to show off craft.

I confess I am guilty.

#1: build a cool SSTO

#2: lauch it

#3: keep making pics

#4: upload to imgur, make an album

#5: post it, realize its all dark and black ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

[http://imgur.com/a/hQoJk#0](http://imgur.com/a/hQoJk#0)

I vow to improve. honestly.

I was also wondering why people post a picture of a craft standing on launchpad/runway at night and u can't see a thing.

Why not hold timewarp for a few seconds?
then they would miss the launchwindow and had to wait 40 years for the next minimum energy grand tour? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Also, I've just noticed: I'm just a few days in in my save, and I've noticed that most of my launches are *nighttime* by default - only launched a handful during a kerbal day.

> 
> then they would miss the launchwindow and had to wait 40 years for the next minimum energy grand tour? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Quicksave > Timewarp > Take pictures > Quickload > Pretend you launched during the day. Unless you've made some cool lighting arrangement on the launch pad, of course.

Well, there's one way to ensure your pictures aren't dark: MOAR BOOSTERS!

[![15935628496_7dcad38afa_h.jpg](https://farm9.staticflickr.com/8637/15935628496_7dcad38afa_h.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/qhbgas)

Or, if you insist on taking night pictures, at least use night-vision (even if it's a totally fake night-vision like this one):

![20150128_ksp0151_wcz147.jpg](http://0div0.org/images/ksp/adlunam/20150128_ksp0151_wcz147.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T22:57:41Z" title="06/21/2015 10:57  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by Cydonian Monk**

Or just take some time to position the darn camera before letting F1 rip:

![0KE1Qpn.png](http://i.imgur.com/0KE1Qpn.png)

The ones that kill me are the people *specifically asking* for help or comments on their craft design, and they only offer a vague black silhouette against a starry black sky.

"Gee, Ricky... it's kinda hard to say what you could do to make your craft better."

[No.](http://i.imgur.com/ySBcwmM.png) Sometimes the darkness is needed for effect or it can't be taken any later. I'm not going to re-do an aerobrake just so it's daytime. 

Unless it's for purposes which require full visibility eg. construction help.

Come to the Darkside, I'm waiting:

![6ls2QBV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/6ls2QBV.jpg)

![agkqjq3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/agkqjq3.jpg)

![ocqeVrb.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ocqeVrb.jpg)

![UmiKifA.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/UmiKifA.jpg)

![x3lFeBV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/x3lFeBV.jpg)

![ZDa0Wuu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ZDa0Wuu.jpg)

![BUOGcP6.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/BUOGcP6.jpg)

Meh, I guess my ODD is playing up again.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-19T14:59:25Z" title="02/19/2015 02:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 19, 2015</time> by Mr Tegu**
